answerText: The Recognitions[10] This postmodernist author of Agape, Agape wrote The Recognitions. He also wrote about an eleven year-old boy who creates a paper financial empire in JR.
heading: ACF Regionals |2013 | Northwestern A | 3 | Literature | American | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: In this novel, Stanley finally plays his organ concerto at a church in Fenestrula, which promptly collapses and kills him. For 10 points each: [10] Name this novel that also features the stabbing of Basil Valentine by the protagonist, an art forger named Wyatt Gwyon.
